Analyze the change in state. When the gas moves from state B to state C, it goes from a higher pressure to a lower pressure.
Since the temperature is constant, the gas molecules will not experience any change in thermal motion.

Determine the final state. Since the thermal motion is not affected by the change in pressure, the thermal motion of gas molecules remains the same at state C.
